description:
Awaiting details...

Shhh! Do you know the secrets and tricks to getting the most out of CP? This mag will tell you! Master the mini games by playing puzzle challenges, protect the island from aliens and check out our latest comic strip about a high speed puffle sled race! All this and more, what are you waiting for? Waddle on to your newsagent today.

In this issue...

Shhh! Wanna discover top secret tricks, tips and secrets to help you master Club Penguin like a pro? Then get your flippers on this fun-packed issue and prepare to max out your coins and amaze your penguins pals! What's more, every reader gets an awesome free gift and 1500 coins!

In this issue...

STEVEN MOFFAT REVEALS SECRETS ABOUT PETER CAPALDI'S FIRST SERIES IN DOCTOR WHO MAGAZINE #476

Showrunner and head writer Steven Moffat gives DWM readers an exclusive guide to the new series of Doctor Who...

'Oh, it's a proper blockbuster this episode,' writes Steven about one of the brand new adventures, 'so many explosions that Peter Capaldi came in on his day off to watch the Daleks blowing up! I like a Doctor who revels in the destruction of evil in his downtime…'

Also in this issue:

  • Doctor Who's production designer Michael Pickwoad on how to create entire worlds.
  • Former script editor Andrew Cartmel talks to the writers he employed on what could have been Doctor Who's very last season: Ben Aaronovitch, Ian Briggs, Marc Platt and Rona Munro.
  • Terrance Dicks – script editor, writer and novelist supreme – talks about his work on Target's Doctor Who books.
  • DWM pays tribute to the life and times of director Derek Martinus, the man who introduced the Cybermen, Ice Warriors and Autons to Doctor Who.
  • The Fact of Fiction takes a detailed look at the 1982 Fifth Doctor adventure, Kinda.
  • The Crystal Throne ­– the brand new comic strip adventure starring Vastra, Jenny and Strax continues.
  • The Time Team watch the Doctor meet River Song for the first time in Silence in the Library/Forest of the Dead.
  • Jacqueline Rayner and her family get World Cup fever as they wait for the start of the new series in Relative Dimensions.
  • The Watcher poses more questions and reveals dubious secrets from the archives in Wotcha!
  • Reviews and previews of the latest CDs and books.
  • Official news, the DWM crossword, prize-winning competitions and much more!

In this issue...

READ PETER CAPALDI'S MOST EXTENSIVE AND REVEALING INTERVIEW TO DATE, ONLY IN DOCTOR WHO MAGAZINE 477!

In a bumper-sized 100-page issue, DWM catches up on set with the PETER CAPALDI – the new Doctor Who.

Doctor Who Magazine asked Peter how he has gone about making the part of the Doctor his own...

"Well," says Peter, "you begin with yourself. You begin with those elements of yourself that you feel would be at home in the role. There's an old actors' adage that you don't become the role, the role becomes you. It's trying to find those parts of you that will fit with the Doctor, and understand those bits that don't come so naturally to you, that you have to fabricate. I kept looking for people in my life who I thought had elements of the Doctor about them, and were inspirational in some ways. I composed a list of those..."

"Also, it's recognising what's been written," Peter continues. "My Doctor is written slightly differently from some of the other Doctors, and the Doctor changes quite dramatically from episode to episode. Some demand more of your comedy chops, graver or more serious episodes demand a more sombre creature. All these variations have to live in the same body, in the same face. Putting all that together is tricky..."

ALSO THIS ISSUE:

  • Read extensive previews of the first four episodes of the new series – Deep Breath, Into the Dalek, Robot of Sherwood and Listen – as DWM talks exclusively to writers STEVEN MOFFAT, PHIL FORD and MARK GATISS.
  • Doctor Who showrunner STEVEN MOFFAT answers readers' questions and reveals more behind-the-scenes secrets in his exclusive column.
  • DWM reunites former Doctor and companion team TOM BAKER and LOUISE JAMESON with their producer, PHILIP HINCHCLIFFE, to chat about the new Doctor Who adventures that they're working on, and reminisce about the 1970s adventures.
  • LOUISE JAMESON writes a very special letter to herself, exclusively for Doctor Who Magazine.
  • A brand new comic strip begins: The Eye of Torment written by Scott Gray, illustrated by Martin Geraghty.
  • DWM examines the unique scrapbooks of PETER HAWKINS, the man who was the voice of the Daleks in the 1960s.
  • The Fact of Fiction takes a detailed look at the 1964 First Doctor adventure, The Reign of Terror.
  • Legendary writer TERRANCE DICKS talks about his later work on Doctor Who – and what he thinks of the series today.
  • The Time Team face an unknown horror as they watch the 2008 Tenth Doctor adventure Midnight.
  • Jacqueline Rayner writes on the perils of watching Doctor Who on a dodgy TV in Relative Dimensions.
  • The Watcher extols the virtues of not giving in to temptation in Wotcha!
  • Reviews and previews of the latest CDs and books.
  • Official news, the DWM crossword, prize-winning competitions and much more!
  • PLUS! A giant, double-sided poster, featuring Peter Capaldi as the Doctor!

In this issue...

COMEDIAN FRANK SKINNER CHATS EXCLUSIVELY ABOUT HIS DOCTOR WHO ROLE – IN DWM 478!

FRANK SKINNER – Mummy on the Orient Express guest star, and life-long Doctor Who fan – speaks about his role in the new series, playing Perkins.

“I don’t know how I’ll feel when they say, ‘And that’s a wrap for Mr Skinner,’” Franks admits. “I’m sure I’ll go through a mix of emotions. When footballers are in cup finals, the managers always say, ‘Savour every moment,’ and that’s what I’m doing. Every moment is ‘wowee’!”

ALSO INSIDE THIS ISSUE:

  • Extensive previews of Episodes 5 to 8 of the new series – Time Heist, The Caretaker, Kill the Moon and Mummy on the Orient Express. DWM talks exclusively to writers STEVEN MOFFAT, STEPHEN THOMPSON, GARETH ROBERTS, PETER HARNESS and JAMIE MATHIESON.
  • Doctor Who showrunner STEVEN MOFFAT answers readers’ questions in his exclusive column.
  • DWM talks to BILLY HANSHAW, the man who inspired the brand new title sequence for this year’s series of Doctor Who.
  • DWM investigates the nature of ‘spoilers’ and asks if they really spoil anything?
  • Into the Dalek writer PHIL FORD talks about getting to know a Dalek from the inside out!
  • In-depth reviews the Twelfth Doctor’s first four adventures: Deep Breath, Into the Dalek, Robot of Sherwood and Listen.
  • As audio company Big Finish celebrates its 15th anniversary with an epic audio adventure, The Worlds of Doctor Who, DWM talks to its stars including COLIN BAKER, LOUISE JAMESON, LALLA WARD, CHRISTOPHER BENJAMIN, TREVOR BAXTER and JAMIE GLOVER.
  • The Doctor and Clara’s comic strip adventures continue in The Eye of Torment written by Scott Gray, illustrated by Martin Geraghty.
  • The Time Team comment on the 2008 Tenth Doctor adventure Turn Left.
  • Jacqueline Rayner finds unexpected inspiration for her Relative Dimensions column at the breakfast table…
  • A look back at August’s Doctor Who World Tour which saw PETER CAPALDI and JENNA COLEMAN travel round the globe to promote the new series.
  • The Watcher eloquently explains why Doctor Who belongs in the Autumn in Wotcha!
  • The DWM crossword, prize-winning competitions and much more!

In this issue...

STEVEN MOFFAT TALKS ABOUT THE SEASON FINALE IN DWM 479!

Head writer Steven Moffat talks about the return of the Cybermen in this year's final adventure.

"I really wanted to do a Cyberman story," says Steven, "because they were always my favourites when I was a kid, and I was quite surprised that one way or another I'd never used them in any of my own scripts, except as supporting characters. So I wanted to do a proper scary one..."

ALSO INSIDE THIS ISSUE:

  • Extensive previews of Episodes 9 to 12 of the new series – Flatline, In the Forest of the Night, Dark Water and Death in Heaven. DWM talks exclusively to writers Jamie Mathieson, Frank Cottrell Boyce and Steven Moffat.
  • DWM interviews Samuel Anderson, aka Danny Pink
  • Steven Moffat answers readers’ questions in his exclusive column
  • DWM talks to Derrick Sherwin, Doctor Who's producer in the late 1960s.
  • Kill the Moon writer Peter Harness talks in depth about the script for his episode.
  • Reviews of the latest TV adventures: Time Heist, The Caretaker, Kill the Moon and Mummy on the Orient Express.
  • DWM talks to the stars of the Eighth Doctor's latest audio series, Dark Eyes 3, including Paul McGann, Alex Macqueen & Georgia Moffett.
  • The Doctor and Clara’s comic strip adventures continue in The Eye of Torment written by Scott Gray, illustrated by Martin Geraghty.
  • The Time Team comment on the 2008 Tenth Doctor episode The Stolen Earth.
  • Jacqueline Rayner writes about the different ways of watching new episodes in Relative Dimensions.
  • The results of the DWM 2013 Merchandise Poll are revealed.
  • The Watcher tackles the controversial subject of last-minute edits in Wotcha!
  • The DWM crossword, prize-winning competitions and much more!

In this issue...

MICHELLE GOMEZ REVEALS THAT THE MASTER WILL RETURN – IN DWM 480!

Michelle Gomez, who plays the latest incarnation of that galactic jackanapes the Master, speaks to Doctor Who Magazine about her evil role...

"Everything about making the Master the Mistress kind of ups the ante," says Michelle. "It makes everything that little bit more dangerous. It blows open this Pandora's box."

Michelle probably can't reveal whether or not she'll be back as Missy next year, but DWM asks her anyway, apropos of nothing.

"Yes," replies Michelle.

Now, that was surprising!

"'Yes' is my answer. I'll be back. Can I say that? Am I allowed? If not... well, I guess we'll have to see how she's received..."

The full interview with Michelle Gomez appears inside DWM 480.

ALSO INSIDE THIS ISSUE:

  • DWM interviews Douglas Mackinnon, the director of Listen, Time Heist and Flatline.
  • Steven Moffat answers readers’ questions in his exclusive column.
  • DWM investigates the question: 'Is the Doctor a good man?'
  • Toby Hadoke pays tribute to the late Lynda Bellingham, the actress who played the Inquistitor in 1986's The Trial of a Time Lord.
  • Siobhan Redmond, the new Rani, talks exclusively to DWM about her first audio story.
  • The Doctor and Clara’s comic strip adventures continue in The Eye of Torment written by Scott Gray, with art by Martin Geraghty.
  • The Fact of Fiction investigates the classic 2005 Ninth Doctor adventure The Empty Child/The Doctor Dances.
  • The Time Team comments on the blockbuster 2008 Tenth Doctor episode Journey's End.
  • Jacqueline Rayner has to stay up late for her Doctor's appointment in Relative Dimensions.
  • The DWM Review examines Flatline and In the Forest of the Night.
  • The Watcher looks at subtitle howlers in Wotcha!
  • The DWM crossword, prize-winning competitions and much more!

In this issue...Doctor Who Magazine #482

JENNA COLEMAN TALKS ABOUT THE LOVES AND LIVES OF CLARA OSWALD, EXCLUSIVELY IN DWM 482!

Jenna Coleman, who plays the Doctor's companion Clara Oswald, gives a revealing interview about her time so far on Doctor Who...

DWM asks Jenna if the Doctor and Clara can finally move on in their relationship – and after the sacrifice of Danny Pink, can things ever be the same again? “I think so," Jenna says. "But they are a bit addicted to each other, and to the dynamic that they share. It's getting so that one can't go without the other, and I think that's definitely what Clara's realised. In a way that's quite dangerous now, because she realises that there is no going back for her..."

ALSO INSIDE ISSUE 482 OF DWM...

  • Rachel Talalay, director of the 2014 series finale two-part finale, reveals the secrets of how Death in Heaven was brought to the screen.
  • Peter Purves, who starred as companion Steven Taylor in the 1960s, talks in-depth about his time on Doctor Who.
  • Discover fascinating new facts about the acclaimed Seventh Doctor story The Greatest Show in Galaxy in The Fact of Fiction.
  • Doctor Who showrunner Steven Moffat answer readers’ questions – including the knotty problem of the Doctor's many wives! – in his exclusive column.
  • Writer David Fisher, who wrote three memorable stories for the Fourth Doctor in the 1970s, revisits his work.
  • The Doctor and Clara face Sontarans and Nazis as The Instruments of War continues, a brand-new comic strip written and illustrated by Mike Collins.
  • Sarah Jane and the Brigadier are reunited, as the Time Team watch The Sarah Jane Adventures: Enemy of the Bane.
  • Jaqueline Rayner wonders how the Doctor's companions would get on in the Cubs in Relative Dimensions.
  • Last Christmas is put under the spotlight in The DWM Review.
  • The Watcher considers the many surprising ways that Doctor Who stories can change from script to screen in Wotcha!.
  • The Watcher gives the answers to his Fiendishly Festive Christmas Quiz! How well did you do?
  • Have your say on Peter Capaldi’s first series as the Doctor in the DWM Season Survey.
  • The DWM Crossword, prize-winning competitions, and much more!
name: The Instruments of War, Part Two

description:
100-PAGE SPECIAL! WRAPAROUND COVER!

A brand-new volume launches a stunning new storyline! The original X-Men journey from the past to the present – and confront their older selves! Cyclops and Magneto begin the mutant revolution!

Featuring material first published in All-New X-Men #1-4 and A+X #3.

76 pages of mutant mayhem!

The teenage X-Men's adventures in the present day continue! Cyclops encounters Mystique! The two Angels meet! Marvel Girl gets a terrifying history lesson! Don't miss 'Here Comes Yesterday'!

Featuring material first published in All-New X-Men #5-8.

76 pages of Mutant Mayhem!

The mutant revolution has begun! Cyclops leads the new X-Men against SHIELD and the Avengers! The two Angels battle the hordes of Hydra! By Brian Michael Bendis, David Marquez and Chris Bachalo!

Featuring material first published in All-New X-Men #8 and Uncanny X-Men #1-3.

76 pages of Mutant Mayhem!

Cyclops discovers Magneto's betrayal, and Marvel Girl faces the power of the Stepford Cuckoos! By Brian Michael Bendis and Stuart Immonen!

Featuring material first published in Uncanny X-Men #3 and All-New X-Men #9-11.

76 pages of Mutant Mayhem!

Magik's powers are out of control – and that spells a seriously bad trip into Limbo for the X-Men! By Brian Michael Bendis and Frazer Irving!

The Original X-Men encounter the Uncanny Avengers – get ready for Marvel Girl versus the Scarlet Witch! By Brian Michael Bendis and Stuart Immonen!

Featuring material first published in Uncanny X-Men #4-6 and All-New X-Men #12.

76 pages of Mutant Mayhem!

Wolverine and Kitty Pryde lead the original X-Men into battle against Mystique and Sabretooth! More action from Brian Michael Bendis and Stuart Immonen!

Featuring material first published in Uncanny X-Men #6-8 and All-New X-Men #13.

76 pages of Mutant Mayhem!

Wolverine and Kitty Pryde lead the original X-Men into battle with Mystique and Sabretooth – but are they ready for the terrifying consequences?! More action by Brian Michael Bendis and Stuart Immonen!

Featuring material first published in All-New X-Men #14 and Uncanny X-Men #8-10.

76 Pages of Gamma-Powered Action!

The Hulk and Thor join forces in the mystical realm of Jotunheim – but the dreaded Frost Giants have a cunning plan...! By Mark Waid and Walt Simonson!

She-Hulk and Lyra hunt the Red Ghost and his Super-Apes! By Harrison WIlcox and Ryan Stegman!

The Red She-Hulk and Machine Man are attacked by SHIELD! By Jeff Parker, Carlo Pagulayan and Wellinton Alves!

Featuring material first published in Indestructible Hulk #7, She-Hulks #2 and Red She-Hulk #63.

76 pages of gamma-powered action!

The Hulk and Thor battle the sinister Frost Giants of Jotunheim! More mythical action from Mark Waid and Walter Simonson!

She-Hulk and Lyra take on Klaw and the Mad Thinker! By Harrison WIlcox and Ryan Stegmen!

The Red She-Hulk and Machine Man uncover a secret at the heart of the world! By Jeff Parker, Carlo Pagulayan and Wellinton Alves!

Featuring material first printed in Indestructible Hulks #8, She-Hulks #3 and Red She-Hulk #64.

76 pages of gamma-charged action!

The Hulk and Daredevil join forces when a deadly weapon is unleashed in New York! By Mark Waid and Matteo Scalera!

She-Hulk and Lyra battle the Wizard! By Harrison Wilcox and Ryan Stegman!

The Red She-Hulk and Machine Man confront the warriors of the Terranometer! By Jeff Parker, Carlo Pagulayan and Wellinton Alves!

Featuring material first published in Indestructible Hulk #9, She-Hulks #4 and Red She-Hulk #65.

76 pages of gamma-powered action!

The Hulk and Daredevil take on the murderous Baron Zemo in the heart of New York! By Mark Waid and Mattero Scalera!

The Hulk faces a legendary opponent: the Monster of Frankenstein! By Jeff Parker and Gabriel Hardman!

The Red She-Hulk enters the crossroads of reality! By Jeff Parker, Carlo Pagulayan and Wellinton Alves!

Featuring material first published in Indestructible Hulk #10, Hulk Monster-Size Special #1 and Red She-Hulk #66.

76 pages of gamma-charged action!

The Hulk is sent on a mission to rescue history itself! Don't miss a time-travel adventure guest-starring the Rawhide Kid! By Mark Waid and Matteo Scalera!

The Red Hulk faces the mystical fury of the Wendigo!

The Red She-Hulk, Machine Man and She-Hulk battle to save reality! By Jeff Parker, Carlo Pagulayan and Patrick Olliffe!

Featuring material first published in Indestructible Hulk #11-12, King-Size Hulk #1 and Red She-Hulk #67.

76 pages of gamma-charged action!

The Hulk smashes his way across the temporal universe as reality begins to shatter! Don't miss 'Agent of TIME' by Mark Waid, Matteo Scalera and Kim Jacinto!

The Hulk is confronted by the Champions in an untold tale! By Peter David and Juan Santacruz!

She-Hulk and the Red Hulk have a chilling first encounter! By Jeph Loeb and Frank Cho!

Featuring material first published in Indestructible Hulk #13-14, King-Size Hulk #1 and Giant-Size Hulk #1.

76 action-packed pages!

Captain America battles Scourge in a deadly fight to the finish!

Plus, as war rages across the realms, Loki seeks a way to right his wrong! But first he must face Thor!

Also, the Mandarin’s scheme is almost complete and tiume is running out for Tony Stark! Plus, the new Iron Man versus Rescue!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.6 #14, Journey Into Mystery #643, Mighty Thor Vol.4 #19 and Invincible Iron Man #523!

76 action-packed pages

A new Captain America Adventure begins! Who are the deadly Discordians and can Captain America and the Falcon stop them?!

Plus, Thor is betrayed and trapped in Muspelheim!

Also, Pepper Potts is attacked by Rescue, and time is running out for Tony Stark to stop the Mandarin!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.6 #14, Journey Into Mystery #643, Mighty Thor Vol.4 #19 and Invincible Iron Man #523!

100-Page special!

It's war on the streets as the Discordians attack! Can Captain America and SHIELD stem the tide of destruction?

Also, the Hel-Wolf is hunting Loki, and the fate of Thor is revealed!

Plus, Iron Man and his allies battle the Mandarin and his Titanomechs!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.6 #16-17, Journey Into Mystery #645, Mighty Thor Vol.4 #21 and Invincible Iron Man #525!

76 action-packed pages!

It's the final battle as Captain America takes the fight to Hydra! Plus, will Thor's plan work? Can he defeat the demonic might of Surtur?!

Also, can Iron Man stop the Mandarin and his Titanomechs before they destroy the Earth's core?!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.6 #18, Mighty Thor Vol.4 #21, Journey Into Mystery #645 and Invincible Iron Man #526!

76 action-packed pages!

What does it mean to be Captain America? Steve Rogers has serious questions about his role as the Sentinel of Liberty!

Also: Iron Man has defeated the Mandarin! But is Tony Stark ready for the fall out?!

Plus: for the crime of heroism, the trial of Thor begins!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.6 #19, Mighty Thor Vol.4 #22 and Invincible Iron Man #527!

100 action-packed pages!

An awesome new era of Marvel action begins!

Captain America is at the mercy of Arnim Zola and trapped in Dimension Z! What horrors await the Sentinel of Liberty in a world Zola’s creation?!!

Also, AIM has Extremis and is selling it to the highest bidder! Only Iron Man can stop them! Guess he's gonna need a new suit!

Plus, Gods are being murdered! To save his past, present and future, Thor must unravel the gruesome mystery of the God Butcher!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.7 #1 and 2, Iron Man Vol.6 #1 and Thor: God of Thunder #1!

76 legendary pages!

Trapped in the nightmare known as Dimension Z, can Captain America survive the alien Phrox?!!

Also, Iron Man’s hunt for Extremis brings him into battle with The Circle, self-proclaimed modern day Knights of the Roundtable!

Plus, a young God of Thunder confronts the God Butcher!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.7 #3, Iron Man Vol.6 #2 and Thor: God of Thunder #3!

76 Legendary Pages!

Captain America and his son battle the legions of the diabolical Arnim Zola!

Also, Stealth Armour Iron Man battles the Living Laser, Vibro and Firebrand!

Plus, who is the God Butcher? Thor must discover the terrifying truth!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.7 #4, Iron Man Vol.6 #3 and Thor: God of Thunder #3!

76 Action-Packed Pages in the Mighty Marvel Manner!

Captain America faces a desperate battle against the Captains of Zolandia and Jet Black! Also: Iron Man's hunt for Extremis continues! What terrors await the Armoured Avenger beneath the catacombs of Paris?! Plus: in the distant future, the Lord of Asgard is defeated by the Black Berserkers! In the present, Thor hunts the God Butcher!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.7 #4, Iron Man Vol.6 #3 and Thor: God of Thunder #3!

The Avengers

In this issue, it's an exclusively IRON affair as the marauding mercenary, the Unicorn attacks Stark Towers in a bid to defeat the Armoured Avenger in an incredible new comic strip. War Machine soars into action to help you complete some of the highest-tech puzzles S.H.I.E.L.D. can handle!

Use Iron Man's state-of-the-art technology to get an upper hand on the evil forces of the Marvel Universe, learn to draw the very first version of Iron Man's armour and help S.H.I.E.L.D. track down the world's greatest threats.

With an Avengers Energy Blaster and free Iron Man 3 sticker album, there's never been a better time to test Marvel's metal!

volume.name: Marvel Super Heroes Featuring The Avengers

description:
The Avengers

The maniacal M.O.D.O.C. strikes in another sensational issue of Marvel Super Heroes Magazine!

Check out our brand-new comic strip to see if Hawkeye and Iron Man can put their heads together and take on the mental M.O.D.O.C. and his A.I.M. army! Complete fiendish puzzles, design Thor's new threads and use your Marvel mastery to tackle the world's greatest hero-themed quiz!

A.I.M. is everywhere, and Earth's Mightiest Heroes need your help! So what are you waiting for? Avengers... ASSEMBLE!

volume.name: Marvel Super Heroes Featuring The Avengers

description:
In this issue...

It's MONSTER MAYHEM this month in Marvel Super Heroes Magazine! The sinister Leader unleashes Marvel's most malevolent monsters on the Avengers! Groot, Grogg, Rommbu and Vandoom are on the loose in a BRAND NEW comic strip!

PLUS! Get to know the pint-sized hero who packs a punch: Ant-Man! Test your Marvel knowledge, play gamma-powered games, complete super-powered puzzles and assemble Earth's Mightiest Heroes in another exciting issue of Marvel Super Heroes Magazine!

AND! There are Iron Man 3 Marvel Super Heroes Lego sets up for grabs for the best Marvel Mail post we receive!

volume.name: Marvel Super Heroes Featuring The Avengers

description:
Marvel Super Heroes – The Avengers

To celebrate the brand new Lego Marvel Super Heroes game, it’s a Marvel Super Heroes special this month! To celebrate, we’re giving readers all the usual awesomeness they’re used to: Puzzles, quizzes, fact files, brand new comic strips and activities! PLUS! Be in with a chance to win a Wii U to play the new game on!

Witness the introduction of the Avengers’ most terrifying android adversary — ULTRON! Will technology triumph over Earth’s Mightiest Heroes?! Find out in Marvel Super Heroes – The Avengers #67!

volume.name: Marvel Super Heroes Featuring The Avengers

description:
The Avengers

Take A.I.M., as the Advanced Ideas Mechanics hijack this turbo-charged issue of Marvel Super Heroes! The Super-Adaptoid has been sent in to bring down the Avengers, and it’s up to Captain America to save the day! Can the Sentinel of Liberty adapt to the present to protect the future? Find out here, first!

PLUS Learn A.I.M.’s secrets, outsmart the greatest evil thinkers in the Marvel Universe and design your perfect hero-smashing machine! With a Turbo Racer toy and astonishing stickers, there’s never been a better time to join Earth’s Mightiest Heroes. Avengers… ASSEMBLE!

volume.name: Marvel Super Heroes Featuring The Avengers

description:
The Avengers

Avengers comic strip, features, activities and games.

Prepare yourself for crazy crimson chaos in Marvel Super Heroes: The Avengers! The iron impostor, the Crimson Dynamo, is causing all sorts of technological tyranny, using Iron Man’s stolen tech – will pride come before a fall for the Armoured Avenger?

Get to know Russian Super Heroes, the Winter Guard, play the pilot and plot a perfect path in the Avengers’ Quinjet, decipher corrupted S.H.I.E.L.D. intel and recruit Earth’s Mightiest Heroes for your dream team! There’s never been a better time to get to know Captain America and his uncanny allies. Avengers… Assemble!

volume.name: Marvel Super Heroes Featuring The Avengers

description:
76 pages of Marvel Universe action! Three awesome adventures!

The Guardians of the Galaxy and Iron Man battle the Spartex Empire, and Gamora faces a deadly assassin! By Brian Michael Bendis, Steve McNiven and Sara Pichelli!

Daredevil is hounded by Ikari, and learns the identity of the villain behind him! By Mark Waid and Chris Samnee!

Death Locket faces Hazmat in the lethal new Murder World! Don't miss Avengers Arena By Dennis Hopeless and Kev Walker!

Featuring material first published in Guardians of the Galaxy #3-4, Daredevil #26 and Avengers Arena #2.

76 pages of Marvel Universe adventure!

More Guardians of the Galaxy action! Star Lord discovers a cosmic threat as Gamora battles the lethal Angela! By Brian Michael Bendis and Sara Pichelli!

A group of young superhumans are trapped in Arcade's Murder World – and only one of them will survive it! Darkhawk fights a hidden enemy in 'Avengers Arena'! By Dennis Hopeless and Kev Walker!

Daredevil takes on Ikari in a stunning showdown as Bullseye's plan for vengeance takes a very nasty turn! By Mark Waid and Chris Samnee!

Featuring material first published in Guardians of the Galaxy #5, Daredevil #27 and Avengers Arena #3.

76 pages of Marvel Universe adventure!

The Guardians of the Galaxy and Tony Stark battle the deadly Angela: a warrior from another reality! By Brian Michael Bendis and Sara Pichelli!

Daredevil encounters a nemesis from his childhood, and relives a devastating moment from his past! By Mark Waid and Javier Rodriguez!

The Runaways and the Avengers Academy students clash in the new Murderworld! By Dennis Hopeless and Alessandro Vitti!

Featuring material first published in Guardians of the Galaxy #6-7, Daredevil #28 and Avengers Arena #4.

76 pages of Marvel Universe adventure!

The Guardians of the Galaxy discover Angela's history as the forces of Thanos invade Earth! By Brian Michael Bendis and Sara Pichelli!

Daredevil battles the racist hate group the Sons of the Serpent – but who can he trust?! Award-winning adventure from Mark Waid and Javier Rodriguez!

Kid Briton's past is revealed as Arcade gets even nastier in Avengers Arena! By Dennis Hopeless and Kev Walker!

Featuring material first published in Guardians of the Galaxy #7-8, Daredevil #29 and Avengers Arena #5.

76 pages of adventure in the Marvel Universe! Three incredible stories!

Daredevil encounters the Silver Surfer for the first time, but the cosmic traveller is fighting mad! More action from Mark Waid and Chris Samnee!

The Guardians of the Galaxy battle to save Agent Brand from the forces of Thanos! By Brian Michael Bendis and Francesco Francavilla!

X-23 goes mad, and another young hero dies in the Avengers Arena! By Dennis Hopeless and Kev Walker!

Featuring material first published in Daredevil #30, Guardians of the Galaxy #8-9 and Avengers Arena #6.

100-PAGE SPECIAL! Three amazing stories!

Daredevil faces a devastating race riot in New York, courtesy of his old enemy the Jester! By Mark Waid and Chris Samnee!

Gamora and Angela team up to take on the deadly Badoon! By Brian Michael Bendis and Sara Pichelli!

Arcade's origin is revealed, and Apex's shocking secret is exposed in 'Avengers Arena'! By Dennis Hopeless and Kev Walker!

Featuring material first published in Daredevil #31, Guardians of the Galaxy #10 and Avengers Arena #8-9.

76 pages of Marvel Universe adventure!

Daredevil investigates the racist group called the Sons of the Serpent – and his search leads him to the Legion of Monsters! By Mark Waid and Chris Samnee!

Nico takes on Apex as Arcade's death-match heats up! Another young hero dies in the next shocking chapter of 'Avengers Arena' by Dennis Hopeless and Kev Walker!

Featuring material first published in Daredevil #32 and Avengers Arena #9-11.

Spider-Man Magazine Gets Rebooted!

Look out, web heads, ‘cos Spider-Man Magazine has just had an Ultimate makeover! Starting with this issue, Ultimate Spider-Man Magazine will take YOU to the next level, with all the ultimate comics, character info, challenges -- the ultimate EVERYTHING that you could ever wish for!

We’re kicking things off with nothing less than a full-scale monster invasion! Can Spider-Man cope with the Mole Man’s hideous horrors? Can he overcome the overwhelming evil of the Green Goblin? Grab your copy now to find out!

In this issue...

Swing into action with the new issue of Ultimate Spider-Man magazine - Marvel's premiere purveyor of all things webtastic!

This issue, the sinister Spymaster is on the loose, and it's up to S.H.I.E.L.D.'s top Spider-agent to track him down. Complete confounding puzzles, get the latest intel on Spider-Man's superior spidey gadgets and witness the White Tiger's uncanny abilities in a brand new comic strip.

With a disc-blasting Spider-Shooter for special S.H.I.E.L.D. missions and a GIANT-sized sticker sheet... Ultimate Spider-Man Magazine is a wall-crawling good time!

In this issue...

Spider-Man comic strip, features, activities and games!

It’s the night of the hunter as the fearsome Kraven comes to town! Then, prepare to be taken down by… Robot athletes?! The Mad Thinkers’ mental machinations are the least of Peter Parker’s problems! Run the Gauntlet and time your reflexes! Learn the secrets behind S.H.I.E.L.D.’s spectacular Spider-tech! Create your own robot with your new-found knowledge! Get ready to go for the ultimate spin… In Ultimate Spider-Man Magazine #270!

In this issue...

The Sandman strikes in Ultimate Spider-Man #278! Join everyone's favourite web head as he battles the dusty deviant across 36 pages of arachno action! In our comic strip this month, Spidey must balance his personal life with the role as a super-hero – it's not easy having such spectacular spider-powers!

Jam-packed with puzzles, games, prizes and posters, Ultimate Spider-Man is available now!

Weblines competition – win an Ultimate Spider-Man Costume!

In this issue...

Content: This issue Spidey takes on one of his deadliest ever enemies in the form of the Green Goblin! Follow the fight in our action-packed comic strip, then have a go at designing your very own battle armour to take down ol' green gills! And if that's not enough Goblin action for you, grab a dice and a friend and try to stop the citizens of New York getting goblinized in an awesome two-player adventure game!

In this issue...

Spidey's got his work cut out in this issue's comic strip, because not only is the world's greatest hunter Kraven on his tail, there's also a whole host of Super-Villains including Doc Ock and Sandman attacking New York! But don't worry, there's plenty for you to do too, like taking on all three of the Super-Villains mentioned above in some action-packed puzzles, testing out your Ultimate Spidey knowledge in our True or False quiz, and creating your very own Spidey comic strip!

In this issue...

This issue of Ultimate Spider-Man is as mysterious and mind-bending as they come, with a comic strip featuring the secretive Super-Villain Mysterio, plenty of brain-busting puzzles, and some Spidey-based optical illusions that are guaranteed to get your head spinning!

76 pages of claw-popping action!

X-Force clashes with the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants in a vicious struggle! Evan faces his future as the next Apocalypse! Wolverine is struck down by treachery in 'Final Execution'! By Rick Remender, Dave Williams and Phil Noto!

Deadpool meets Captain Britain! Don't miss the craziest team-up you'll see all year! The fun's supplied by Rob Williams and Matteo Scalera!

Featuring material first published in Uncanny X-Force #32-33 and Deadpool Team-Up #893.

76 pages of claw-popping adventure!

Wolverine fights for his life in the Savage Land against alien gods, giant gorillas and even the Hulk! Guest-starring Shanna the She-Devil! By Frank Cho!

Deadpool tackles the Dead Presidents with help from Doctor Strange!

By Gerry Duggan, Brian Posehn and Tony Moore!

Featuring material first published in Savage Wolverine #4-5 and Deadpool #2-3.

76 pages of claw-popping adventure!

Wolverine takes the X-Students to the Savage Land on a field trip – but his long-lost brother Dog is planning a deadly family reunion! More action from Jason Aaron and Ramon Perez!

Deadpool tangles with Abraham Lincoln – back from the dead and ready to kick ass! More craziness from Brian Posehn, Gerry Duggan and Tony Moore!

Featuring material first printed in Wolverine & The X-Men #24-25 and Deadpool #4-5.

76 pages of mutants and motormouths!

Wolverine fights his long-lost brother Dog while the X-Students take on cowboys, robots, dinosaurs and cavemen! By Jason Aaron and Ramon Perez!

Deadpool clashes with the sinister Ronald Reagan in outer space! By Brian Posehn, Gerry Duggan and Tony Moore!

Featuring material first published in Wolverine & The X-Men #26-27 and Deadpool #5-6.

76 pages of claw-popping mayhem!

Wolverine confronts his brother Dog Logan as the X-Students fight to survive in the Savage Land! More action from Jason Aaron and Ramon Perez!

Deadpool takes on the evil undead George Washington! By Brian Posehn, Gerry Duggan and Tony Moore!

Featuring material first published in Wolverine & The X-Men #28-29 and Deadpool #6-7.

Don't miss a 100-PAGE SPECIAL!

Wolverine leads the X-Men into war against the Hellfire Club! Don't miss the awesome beginning of 'The Hellfire Saga'! By Jason Aaron and Nick Bradshaw!

Deadpool has a SHIELD agent inside his head and a demon at his throat! A wild new story begins by Brian Posehn, Gerry Duggan and Mike Hawthorne!

Featuring material first published in Wolverine & The X-Men #30-32 and Deadpool #8-9.

76 pages of mutants and motormouths!

Wolverine and the X-Men attack the Hellfire Academy! More action from Jason Aaron and Nick Bradshaw!

Deadpool meets the Superior Spider-Man! Wow, that's going to be a friendly team-up! By Brian Posehn, Gerry Duggan and Mike Hawthorne!

Featuring material first published in Wolverine & The X-Men #33-34 and Deadpool #9-10.

Narrator or character? Reality or fiction? In this tender work of cinema, Boilet recounts an intimate love story in today's Tokyo between an everyday Japanese girl, Yukiko, and her occidental lover. Passionate, gentle, fresh and vibrant, it is a love so strong it hurts. Quietly paced, the story unfolds in a host of innovative techniques both narrative and visual. At the heart of the title is Boilet's deliberate (mis)use of the pronounced Japanese for navel and spinach. First serialized in 2000 - 2001 in the monthly Furansugo Kaiwa it is the defining work of Boilet's Nouvelle Manga movement.
